items.title: GM blocks dealership from installing Apple CarPlay retrofit kits in EVs
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
• GM has shut down a dealership’s Apple CarPlay retrofit service for EVs, citing safety concerns.
• The closure follows GM's previous removal of Apple CarPlay and Android Auto from its EVs.
• A third-party kit developed by White Automotive was previously offered but is now listed as discontinued due to GM's intervention.
• The decision raises questions about the impacts on customer satisfaction and aftermarket services.

items.title: Coca-Cola’s new hydrogen-powered vending machine doesn’t need a power outlet
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Coca-Cola is set to install the world’s first hydrogen-powered vending machines at the World Expo 2025 in Osaka, Japan, starting April 13th, 2025.
- Co-developed with Fuji Electric, these machines operate without a power outlet, using replaceable hydrogen cartridges for electricity generation.
- A total of 58 vending machines will be installed, featuring displays to educate visitors on hydrogen power; however, details on the longevity of the hydrogen cartridges have not been disclosed.

items.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket is getting in on the shiny hype
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Pokémon TCG Pocket announces new expansion, Shining Revelry, launching on March 27th.
- The set features shiny versions of popular Pokémon such as Charizard, Pachirisu, and Lucario, along with new characters from recent Switch games.
- Ranked competitive matches will start on March 27th with a related event running until April 26th.
- Shiny Charizard-themed in-game accessories will become available starting April 1st, likely through player objectives.

items.title: Severance brought everything together in its season 2 finale
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The season 2 finale of *Severance* titled "Cold Harbor" successfully addressed many lingering mysteries without feeling forced.
- Mark's journey involved coordinating between his innie and outie versions to rescue Gemma, revealing the connection of multiple Gemma variants to Lumon’s experiments.
- Lumon’s ultimate goal was identified as a “war against pain,” which involves transforming Gemma into an unfeeling version of herself through her variants.
- The finale balanced humor and horror, tying together major plot lines while leaving some questions open for the future, leading into the newly confirmed season 3.

items.title: Trump's confusing crusade against Big Tech
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- President Trump has shifted from wanting to ban TikTok to attempting to save it, amidst discussions of regulatory plans.
- The administration is actively seeking regulations on Big Tech while appearing friendly to top executives.
- Significant tech news includes Apple facing issues with Siri and the return of Pebble smartwatches, alongside new launches from Google and Huawei.
- Discussion includes insights into the TikTok ban, the state of broadband equity initiatives, and ongoing FTC challenges.
- The Vergecast features commentary on a Cybertruck recall, the drama surrounding the book *Careless People*, and Netflix's competitive edge against Apple TV Plus.

items.title: Severance is returning for season 3
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple CEO Tim Cook confirmed the renewal of *Severance* for Season 3 in a reply to producer Ben Stiller.
- The announcement came on the same day as the Season 2 finale debut on Apple TV Plus.
- Producer Ben Stiller indicated that there won’t be another three-year gap between seasons.
- Filming of Season 2 was delayed due to the Hollywood strikes in 2023.
- The show stars Adam Scott as Mark Scout, with other cast members including Brit Lower, Zach Cherry, Tramell Tillman, and Christopher Walken.

items.title: Samsung’s Galaxy Tab S10 FE Plus will be bigger and cost more
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- A leak has revealed details about the upcoming Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE and S10 FE Plus.
- The Galaxy Tab S10 FE Plus features a larger 13.1-inch display, compared to its predecessor's 12.4-inch display.
- The Tab S10 FE will maintain the 10.9-inch size of the previous model.
- There's no confirmation on whether the new models will have OLED displays or an improved refresh rate.
- The FE Plus will have a single 13MP rear camera, dropping the ultrawide camera from previous models.
- Both tablets will be powered by Exynos 1580 chips instead of MediaTek processors used in the main S10 line.
- Pricing starts at €579 for the Galaxy Tab S10 FE and €749 for the S10 FE Plus, both €50 higher than their predecessors.
- US pricing is expected to be similar, with a potential $50 increase.

items.title: ChatGPT accused of saying an innocent man murdered his children
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- A Norwegian man, Arve Hjalmar Holmen, filed a privacy complaint against OpenAI after ChatGPT falsely claimed he was a convicted murderer.
- The chatbot included fictitious details about his life, alleging he had killed two children and attempted to kill a third.
- Advocacy group Noyb filed the complaint, arguing OpenAI violated GDPR by spreading false information.
- Noyb demands a fine and improvements to prevent such errors.
- This is Noyb’s second complaint regarding ChatGPT’s inaccuracies, following a prior incident involving a public figure's incorrect date of birth.

items.title: Heathrow airport shutdown creates travel chaos
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Heathrow airport closed due to a major fire at a nearby electrical substation, affecting thousands of flights.
- The airport will remain closed until at least midnight on Friday for safety reasons.
- 1,357 flights scheduled for today have been disrupted, with 120 flights returning to origin or diverted.
- Passengers advised not to travel to the airport and to check with airlines for information.
- This is the first complete closure of Heathrow since the 2010 Eyjafjallajokull volcano eruption.
- Over 16,000 homes in the area are also facing power outages due to the fire, which is now under control but under investigation.

items.title: The crypto bars are invading Washington
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- A popular DC bar for Republicans will be replaced by Pubkey, a bar that exclusively accepts cryptocurrency.  
- Pubkey, known for its casual vibe and bitcoin focus, will open in DC, confirming its commitment to creating a bipartisan space.  
- The bar's opening follows Trump’s high-profile bitcoin transaction at a Pubkey location in New York, highlighting the growing influence of the crypto community.

items.title: The System Shock 2 remaster comes out June 26th
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- Nightdive Studios is releasing a remastered version of *System Shock 2*, first announced on March 20.
- The remaster, titled *System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster*, will be available on June 26th for PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 4 and 5.
- Visual updates include sharper enemy models and visible hands holding weapons, while maintaining the original game's feel.
- New interface supports console-friendly controls, including DualSense support and a quickbar for weapons and abilities.
- Features cross-play for cooperative multiplayer and integrates existing community mods and the SS2 Community Patch.

items.title: US Attorney General Announces Severe Charges Against Alleged Tesla Arsonists
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Attorney General Pam Bondi announced charges against three individuals responsible for vandalism at Tesla properties.
- Charges include malicious destruction of property and possession of Molotov cocktails, related to incidents at Tesla locations.
- Recent arrests came after multiple reports of vandalism, including arson at Tesla stations in South Carolina and other states.

items.title: Google sues alleged scammers over 10,000 fake Maps listings
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google is suing a network of scammers behind the creation of over 10,000 fake business listings on Google Maps.
- The lawsuit was prompted by reports from a Texas-based locksmith being impersonated.
- Google has removed or blocked 12 million fake business profiles in 2023 and noted an increase in fake listings year over year.
- Scammers exploit fake listings to mislead victims, providing services at inflated prices or directing them to deceptive call centers.
- Google has strengthened its efforts to combat fake reviews and deceptive engagement practices, especially under regulatory pressure in the UK.

items.title: Apple TV Plus is reportedly losing $1 billion per year
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus is losing over $1 billion annually despite having 45 million subscribers in 2024.
- The platform is the only Apple subscription not generating profit.
- Apple cut its content budget for Apple TV Plus by $500 million from an initial $5 billion.
- Apple TV Plus captures less than 1% of monthly streaming services viewership, compared to Netflix’s 8.2%.
- The service was created to bolster the Apple ecosystem, with no current marketing strategy beyond that.
- Apple's other services like Music, News Plus, and Fitness Plus are also struggling with low usage and profits.

items.title: Karma bets on EREVs and ultra-luxury for its latest reboot
items.author: Tim Stevens
items.summary:
- Marques McCammon is the new president of Karma Automotive, aiming to position the brand as a top ultra-luxury vehicle manufacturer in the US.
- Karma Automotive, originally born from Fisker, is rebooting its lineup, moving from the previously announced Kaveya to the new Amaris EREV.
- The Amaris will feature a new four-cylinder engine, enhanced battery chemistry for better performance, and is set to launch in late 2026, priced significantly higher than the current Revero.
- Karma plans to shift away from sourcing battery cells from China amid market demands and potential tariffs, complicating their supply chain.

items.title: Segway is recalling over 200,000 electric scooters that can collapse mid-ride
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Segway has recalled Ninebot Max G30P and Max G30LP electric scooters due to a collapse hazard.
- The recall affects around 220,000 scooters sold since January 2020 at major retailers like Best Buy and Amazon.
- 68 reports of failures have resulted in 20 injuries including serious ones.
- Consumers are advised to stop using the scooters and contact Segway for a free maintenance kit to adjust the folding mechanism.

items.title: Comcast and Spectrum join in on the satellite messaging wave
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Galaxy S25 and Pixel 9 owners on Xfinity Mobile and Spectrum Mobile can send emergency messages via satellite.
- Launch date for this feature was March 20, 2025.
- Customers must have Galaxy S25 or Google Pixel 9 to access the satellite messaging.
- Comcast and Charter's feature follows Verizon's similar rollout for the same devices.
- This service is supported by Skylo, which previously worked with Google on Pixel 9's Satellite SOS.
- Currently, users can only send messages without Wi-Fi or cellular data; receiving SMS over satellite is expected in the coming weeks.
- This move aligns Comcast and Charter with other companies exploring satellite connectivity for mobile devices.

items.title: Netflix has a new plan for games
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Netflix's gaming strategy has been inconsistent since its launch in 2021.
- New president of games Alain Tascan aims to focus on four game categories: narrative, multiplayer party games, children's games, and mainstream releases.
- The strategy resembles Netflix's early approach to original programming, starting small before expanding.
- Netflix plans to scale back on areas like indie game support and previously shut down an internal AAA studio.
- The ultimate goal is to make games easily accessible and playable on any device within five years, similar to the cross-play success of Fortnite.
- New TV-focused games are set to launch by the end of this year, aiming to eliminate the need for controllers.

items.title: The EU wants Apple to open these iOS features to other gadgets
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The European Union has mandated Apple to enhance the interoperability of iOS, detailing features for other devices.
- New guidelines require Apple to open nine iOS-exclusive connectivity features by the end of 2025 to comply with the Digital Markets Act.
- Key features include access to iOS notifications for third-party smartwatches and enabling apps to run in the background for better updates.
- Additional requirements involve allowing third-party headphones to utilize features like SharePlay and audio switching.
- Apple must enable data sharing via AirDrop and AirPlay with non-Apple devices and ease setup for third-party gadget connections.
- Non-compliance could lead to investigations and fines of up to 10% of Apple's annual turnover.

items.title: Here's the Steam on Xbox evidence Microsoft didn't want you to see
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft hinted at a new Xbox UI that may include support for Steam games.
- The UI was briefly revealed in a now-removed post, showing Steam labels on devices.
- Sources indicate that Microsoft is working on an Xbox app update to display games installed on PC, including those from Steam and Epic Games Store.
- Phil Spencer has suggested potential future integration of PC store titles into Xbox consoles.

items.title: An easy to read and interpret title for the article as a string.
items.author: Sarah Jeong
items.summary:
- President Trump fired Democratic commissioners Alvaro Bedoya and Rebecca Kelly Slaughter at the FTC, violating longstanding legal precedent from 1935.
- Outlets including The Verge faced backlash for using cautious language in their headlines, which did not clearly state the firings were illegal.
- The legality of the firings is likely to be challenged in court, with implications for presidential power and the independence of the FTC.

items.title: Google is improving Gmail’s search with AI
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Google is introducing an AI-powered upgrade for Gmail’s search function to enhance email discovery.
- The search results will now consider criteria like recency, most-clicked emails, and frequent contacts, improving the relevance of search outcomes.
- This update is being rolled out globally for personal Google account users, usable in web browsers and Gmail apps for Android and iOS; users can toggle between chronological and relevant results.

items.title: Nintendo, Microsoft, and other developers will share accessibility labels about their games
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Five major video game companies including Nintendo and Microsoft are joining the **Accessible Games Initiative** managed by the ESA.
- The initiative will use 24 tags to denote accessibility features such as “large and clear subtitles” and “narrated menus.”
- Tags will cover auditory, gameplay, input, and visual features and will be displayed on digital storefronts and product pages, with implementation timelines varying by company.
- Founding members include Electronic Arts, Google, Microsoft, Nintendo of America, and Ubisoft; others like Amazon Games and Riot Games have also joined.

items.title: The Pixel 9A’s version of Gemini is missing a few features
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- The Pixel 9A features the Tensor G4 chip but has a text-only version of Gemini AI.
- It lacks access to some AI features due to having only 8GB of RAM.
- The AI model on Pixel 9A is Gemini Nano 1.0 XXS, which is smaller than that on Pixel 9 (12GB RAM) and Pixel 9 Pro (16GB RAM).
- Features missing on Pixel 9A include AI-powered Pixel Screenshots and Call Notes, though it can summarize audio from the Recorder app.
- Gemini AI was previously unavailable on the Pixel 8, launched later due to user demand.

items.title: Zagg’s new tablet dock adds over-sized playback controls to your iPad
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Zagg has launched the Six-Port Media Hub for iPads and Android tablets, expanding connectivity.
- The hub includes HDMI, USB-A, SD/microSD slots, headphone jack, and USB-C with 100W pass-through power.
- It features three dedicated playback buttons for music and videos and an adjustable support for devices.
- Priced at $99.99, it is available on [Zagg's online store](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.zagg.com%2F6-port-media-hub) and on [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/ZAGG-6-Port-Media-Hub-USB/dp/B0DYR3FZKN?tag=theverge02-20).

items.title: Google’s Pixel Buds Pro 2 are now $179, their lowest price yet
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Google’s Pixel Buds Pro 2 are available for $179, down from $229, marking their lowest price yet.
- The earbuds feature better active noise cancellation, improved transparency mode, and longer battery life—up to 12 hours with ANC off.
- Particularly recommended for Android and Pixel phone users, known for their comfort and stability during use. 
- Enhanced call performance makes them suitable for phone calls as well.

items.title: Honda and Acura EV owners will get Tesla Supercharger access this summer
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
[Honda and Acura EV owners will gain access to over 20,000 Tesla Superchargers in June for the Prologue and ZDX models.]
[New charging adapters will be available for purchase to connect CCS1 ports to Tesla's NACS.]
[Honda has not announced free adapters, unlike competitors Ford and Hyundai, but charging is still possible at Superchargers with Magic Dock capabilities.]

items.title: Threads finally lets you set the following feed as default
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Meta allows Threads users to set following or custom feeds as default.
- New features include limiting reply options to followers, a better video player, and the ability to add topics in bios.
- This customizable feed option begins rolling out after user requests since Threads' launch in December 2023.

items.title: Apple puts the Vision Pro guy in charge of Siri
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple is replacing John Giannandrea as the head of Siri and AI, appointing Mike Rockwell, head of Vision Pro development, in his place.
- This decision follows CEO Tim Cook's loss of confidence in Giannandrea's leadership in AI development.
- Apple announced a delay in generative AI upgrades for Siri, now expected to launch next year, citing development taking longer than anticipated.
- Paule Meade will take over as the head of the Vision Pro Group after Rockwell's promotion.

items.title: TikTok will now show missing child notifications
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- TikTok is launching AMBER Alerts in the US, displaying missing child notifications in users' For You feeds.
- The alerts will include a photo of the child and the option to call 911.
- The feature is launched in partnership with the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children.
- TikTok piloted this feature in Texas last year, achieving over 20 million views on the alerts.
- Other apps like Uber, Waze, Facebook, Instagram, and X have also integrated AMBER Alerts.

items.title: This digital notebook simulates E Ink screens to reduce distractions
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The XP-Pen Magic Note Pad simulates E Ink screens using a full-color LCD with three modes: black-and-white, light color, and ink paper mode.
- The device features a nano-etched surface to reduce glare and reflectivity, aiming to replicate the feel of writing on paper.
- Priced at $439.99, the Magic Note Pad is currently available for a limited time at $359.99 and includes the X3 Pro Pencil 2 stylus, which doesn't require charging.

items.title: Netflix’s CEO Talks Competitors and Live Sports Strategy
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Netflix's co-CEO Ted Sarandos discussed competitors like Apple TV Plus and HBO in a recent interview.
- Sarandos expressed confusion over Apple TV's strategy, calling it mainly a marketing play.
- He questioned HBO's rebranding to 'Max' and suggested it would reduce to just HBO in the long run.
- Sarandos indicated that he doesn’t see Amazon's original content as direct competition but admires their live sports strategy.
- Netflix is pushing into live events, focusing on unique, high-profile matches rather than complete seasons, aiming for events like the Super Bowl.

items.title: LG’s NFT marketplace for TVs is shutting down
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- LG is shutting down its NFT marketplace, Art Lab, on June 17th.
- The platform allowed users to buy, sell, and enjoy digital artwork through TVs with transactions facilitated via LG’s crypto wallet, Wallypto.
- Originally launched in 2022, Art Lab operated on the Hedera network before expanding to Ethereum
- Users could buy NFTs with prices ranging from about $59.82 to over $3,800.
- As of March 10th, purchases were halted, and NFTs will automatically transfer to users' wallets by April 30th.
- LG cites the evolving nature of the NFT space as the reason for the shift in focus.

items.title: Tesla recalls more than 46,000 Cybertrucks after trim starts falling off
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Tesla has issued a recall for 46,096 Cybertrucks in the US due to a defect causing steel trim to come loose.
- The recall affects all Cybertrucks manufactured between November 13th, 2023, and February 27th, 2025.
- Approximately 1% of the impacted vehicles have been identified as having the trim defect.
- This is the eighth recall for the Cybertruck since its launch in December 2023.
- The issue has been reported by several owners and documented in forums and YouTube teardown videos.
- Tesla will replace the cant rail for free using new adhesive and clamping the panel to ensure safety.

items.title: The beautiful, retro tech of two theatrical sound designers
items.author: Kristen Radtke
items.summary:
- Creative couple [Jessie Char](https://jessiechar.com/) and [Maxwell Neely-Cohen](https://maxy.world/) blend various art forms in their Brooklyn loft.
- They use vintage tech for sound design in theater, highlighted by their work on original sound cues for plays.
- Their first sound design project emerged from the writers' strike in 2023, leading them to create a fully scored play with sophisticated sound setups.
- Both prioritize manual creativity over smart tech, opting for personal connections and vintage equipment.

items.title: How the Tesla brand turned so toxic
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Protests against Tesla branded as #TeslaTakedown, sparked by dissatisfaction with Elon Musk's actions.
- Tesla showrooms and charging stations are witnessing growing protests, with increasing police presence.
- Tesla's stock is declining, new car registrations are down, and owning a Tesla has become politically charged.
- Public criticism of Tesla products is rising, with popular YouTubers highlighting shortcomings in vehicles and self-driving technology.
- Ed Niedermeyer, an organizer of the protests, discusses the disparity between Tesla's mythos and reality, framing it as a pivotal moment for the company.

items.title: The Digimon franchise is getting a mobile card game of its own
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Bandai Namco announced the development of a new mobile card game, Digimon Alysion, during Digimon Con.
- The game will be free-to-play for iOS and Android, featuring card battles and a story mode.
- Players will also be able to raise virtual pets similar to Tamagotchi.
- A teaser trailer introduced the protagonist Kanata Hondo and her Digimon partner Gemmon.
- A closed beta for Digimon Alysion is expected to launch in the coming months, but no release date has been provided.

items.title: We’ve entered a forever war with bird flu
items.author: Lauren Leffer
items.summary:
- Avian influenza H5N1 evolving rapidly, adapting to mammals.
- Human cases in the US rising, especially among farmworkers; risk of human-to-human transmission increasing.
- Over 70 confirmed human cases in the US, with recent hospitalizations and one death.
- Virus infected nearly 1,000 dairy herds since its detection in cows in 2024.
- A new D1.1 genotype of the virus spreading; potential for more severe human cases.
- Bird flu detected in domestic animals and wildlife, including cats and rodents.
- Experts suggest H5N1 is likely endemic, making eradication impossible.
- Calls for increased surveillance on farms and monitoring of potential animal reservoirs.
- Vaccination and biosecurity measures remain crucial for managing the outbreak.

items.title: Discord is bringing mobile ads to its platform
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
* Discord will launch a mobile pilot for Video Quests in June 2025.
* Users can earn rewards by watching ads, which will appear as a Quest bar at the bottom of the screen.
* Discord had previously been ad-free and relied on subscriptions for revenue.
* This rollout follows earlier tests and comes amid rumors of an upcoming IPO.

items.title: YouTube is investigating a bug causing low-res videos
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- YouTube is experiencing a bug causing videos and shorts to stream at 144p or 360p for some users.
- This issue is reported on iOS, desktop, and smart TVs, regardless of internet connection strength.
- Users have reported that attempts to manually change video quality lead to it reverting back to low resolution.
- YouTube is aware of the problem and is actively investigating it, promising updates on their support thread.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- President Trump’s executive orders have threatened diversity programs in space science.
- NASA has suspended funding and activities for diversity and outreach programs due to these orders.
- Trump fired the remaining Democratic commissioners at the FTC, raising concerns about the influence of billionaires.
- The Trump administration plans significant budget cuts to the EPA, potentially undermining environmental protections.
- Nearly 25,000 federal employees are being reinstated following a court order after mass terminations under Trump’s government restructuring efforts.

items.title: Space science is under threat from the anti-DEI purge
items.author: Georgina Torbet
items.summary:
- President Trump's executive orders demanding an end to diversity programs have disrupted the space science community.
- NASA has suspended funding and banned activities related to diversity and outreach initiatives, affecting many employees.
- The threat of significant layoffs and budget cuts looms over NASA, raising fears among employees about job security and future funding.
- Many NASA workers are removing LGBTQIA symbols and pronouns from email signatures due to fears of repercussions.
- Experts warn that the rollback of diversity initiatives could hinder scientific discovery and create a less creative workforce.
- Individuals in the field of space science report feeling confused and fearful due to conflicting information regarding government policies.
- The push against diversity contradicts previous bipartisan support for NASA's diversity programs and scientific evidence that diverse groups yield better outcomes in research.

items.title: Huawei’s new flip phone is weirdly wide
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Huawei has launched the Pura X, a new flip phone with a 16:10 aspect ratio, opening sideways rather than vertically.
- This is Huawei's first phone to run HarmonyOS Next, which is not compatible with Android apps.
- The Pura X features a triple camera setup, a 6.3-inch display, and is priced at 7,499 yuan (around $1,037) in China.

items.title: Fujifilm’s GFX100RF puts medium format guts in a compact fixed-lens camera
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Fujifilm announced the GFX100RF, the lightest camera in the GFX series with a fixed-lens design.
- It features a 35mm lens, equivalent to 28mm in full frame, with a 102-megapixel sensor.
- Priced at $4,899.95, it will be available in April and includes a four-stop ND filter and an aspect ratio dial.

items.title: Bluetti’s Handsfree 1 is the solar backpack I love hating
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- The Bluetti Handsfree 1 Backpack costs $349 and combines a 42L backpack with a 268.8Wh solar generator.
- The backpack can recharge with up to 200W of solar power and has multiple USB and AC ports for powering devices.
- Weighing 5kg (11 pounds), it is designed to carry a full remote office setup but is criticized for its bulky and unattractive design.
- The Good: Powers entire remote office setups, rechargeable with solar, affordable.
- The Bad: Unattractive design, heavy when full, lacks waterproofing.
- The backpack supports loads up to 30kg (66 pounds) with adjustable weight distribution features.

items.title: Meta AI is Rolling Out in Europe After Delay
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta AI is launching in Europe after a delay of almost one year.
- The rollout includes 41 European countries and 21 overseas territories, limited to text-based chat features.
- Previous launch attempts were paused due to privacy concerns raised by Ireland's regulations.
- Users can brainstorm, plan trips, and answer questions using the web, but cannot generate or edit images.
- The assistant has not been trained on EU user data.
- Meta is committed to collaborate with regulators for future expansions of AI capabilities in Europe.

items.title: Tesla Protesters Plan Global Demonstrations on March 29th
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Protests against Tesla are scheduled for March 29th, aiming for 500 demonstrations worldwide.
- The movement started in early February and has expanded to hundreds of locations.
- Protesters oppose CEO Elon Musk's actions related to federal aid program dismantling and service cutbacks.
- An increase in vandalism and violence, unrelated to protests, has led to tensions with officials labeling them as 'domestic terrorism'.
- Tesla’s stock has declined nearly 40% this year, spurring protests as activists aim to diminish its market value.
- Organizers emphasize peaceful demonstrations while preparing for possible legal confrontations.

items.title: The Best Wireless Earbuds to Buy Right Now
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The market for wireless earbuds has improved significantly, offering better sound quality and performance.
- Companies like Sony, Apple, and Samsung are leading with impressive models.
- Key considerations include noise cancellation, sound quality, fit, and compatibility with devices.
- The article features recommendations for various budgets and needs, highlighting:
  - [Sony WF-1000XM5](https://www.amazon.com/Sony-WF-1000XM5-Bluetooth-Canceling-Headphones/dp/B0C33XXS56/?tag=theverge02-20): Best overall, priced at $248, notable for enhanced ANC and sound quality.
  - [Nothing Ear (a)](https://www.amazon.com/Nothing-Ear-Integration-Cancelling-Equaliser/dp/B0CXPR5412/?tag=theverge02-20): Budget pick at $99, features great performance and design.
  - [Bose QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/Bose-QuietComfort-Cancelling-World-Class-Cancellation/dp/B0CD2FSRDD/?tag=theverge02-20): Excellent ANC with a price of $219.
  - [Beats Powerbeats Pro 2](https://www.amazon.com/Beats-Powerbeats-Wireless-Bluetooth-Earbuds/dp/B0DT2344N3/?tag=theverge02-20): Fitness-focused with heart rate monitoring, priced at $249.

items.title: Fired FTC commissioner warns of the ‘corrupting influence of billionaires’
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Commissioner Alvaro Bedoya criticized President Trump for firing him and Rebecca Kelly Slaughter from the FTC, calling it unlawful and beneficial to tech billionaires.
- Their removal raises concerns about the independence of government agencies; Bedoya questioned who benefits from their removal.
- Bedoya linked his firing to his previous criticism of Amazon's Jeff Bezos and noted that many tech executives benefit from the dismissals, particularly those involved in active litigation with the FTC.
- Over two dozen Democratic senators urged Trump to reverse the firings, emphasizing the violation of Supreme Court precedent and the undermining of consumer protection efforts.
- Bedoya highlighted the broader issue of billionaires' influence in politics, remarking that it transcends party lines and impacts law enforcement and regulatory actions.

items.title: The best noise-canceling headphones to buy right now
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Noise-canceling headphones are essential for commuting, traveling, and working from home.
- Major brands include Bose, Sony, Apple, Bowers & Wilkins, and Sennheiser.
- Criteria for choosing the best headphones include noise cancellation, comfort, and battery life.
- Over-ear and on-ear headphones can be more comfortable than earphones, and their battery life typically exceeds that of earbuds.
- Noise-canceling technology has improved, with headphones like Sony’s WH-1000XM5 offering excellent sound quality and comfort.
